Sequencing_Types.Description: Explicitly relates terms from different passages, adding meaning. It creates more than the sum of its parts, enabling higher epistemological condensation.

Subtypes.Description: Condenses meanings from one or more passages and transports those meanings into another passage.

Sub_Subtypes.Description: Condenses and transports meanings from more than one passage.
Condenses and transports meanings from within a single passage. Often involves successive passages.

Subtypes.Description: Links passages without explicitly transporting meanings across passages.

Sub_Subtypes.Description: Indicates how meanings from different passages shape one another.
Indicates the ordering of meanings from different passages. Adds only temporal relations.

Sequencing_Types.Description: Does not explicitly relate terms from constitutive passages.

Sub_Subtypes.Description: Involves the sequencing of passages with no significant relation to each other.
Involves the sequencing of passages that offer continuity.

Subtypes.Description: Brings together similar or identical passages.

Sub_Subtypes.Description: Involves similar passages with sufficient difference to add meanings.
